content: The "Screening Mammography Act of 2001" mandates coverage for annual screening mammography under group health plans, with standards relating to benefits for screening mammography outlined in the Public Health Service Act. The "Screening Mammography Act of 2001" requires group health plans to cover annual screening mammography on terms not less favorable than diagnostic mammography, as defined by medically necessary radiologic procedures for diagnosing breast cancer. The "Screening Mammography Act of 2001" mandates coverage for annual screening mammography by group health plans without denial based on medical necessity or referral by a healthcare provider. The text chunk discusses prohibitions related to group health plans, including not denying eligibility based on avoiding certain requirements, not providing incentives to accept less protection, not penalizing providers for following the plan's guidelines, and not incentivizing providers to deviate from care standards. The section clarifies that participants or beneficiaries are not required to undergo annual screening mammography. It also exempts group health plans that do not cover diagnostic mammography and allows for cost-sharing for annual screening mammography benefits. Standards for screening mammography benefits are outlined in SEC. 714. SEC. 714 outlines requirements for coverage of annual screening mammography under group health plans and health insurance issuers, ensuring coverage is not less favorable than diagnostic mammography. Diagnostic mammography is defined as a medically necessary radiologic procedure for diagnosing breast cancer. Annual screening mammography is a radiologic procedure done annually for early breast cancer detection, including a physician's interpretation of the results. Group health plans and insurers cannot deny coverage based on medical necessity or lack of referral. Cost-sharing can still be imposed on benefits for screening mammography. The section allows group health plans to require consultation with a healthcare practitioner before more frequent annual screening mammography, but does not mandate prior authorization for annual screenings. The section allows group health plans to negotiate reimbursement for care provided in accordance with annual screening mammography requirements. The requirements of this section do not apply to health insurance coverage in states with laws regulating coverage for annual screening mammography. Effective January 1, 2002, amendments regarding benefits for screening mammography apply to group health plans and insurance coverage. COVERAGE OF ANNUAL SCREENING MAMMOGRAPHY UNDER INDIVIDUAL HEALTH COVERAGE. Amends Part B of title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act to include standards for benefits related to screening mammography. The provisions of section 2707 apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market, with notice requirements similar to group health plans. The amendments made by this section require coverage for annual screening mammography in the individual health insurance market, with protections similar to those in section 2707(b). State laws regulating such coverage are not superseded, and the effective date is January 1, 2002. "Coverage of annual screening mammography under Medicaid."
